etymology.description: semantic 土 (“soil”) + phonetic 成 (OC *djeŋ); city walls were made of stamped earth.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the meaning of soil with the sound of 成 to depict an earthen-walled settlement. Evokes early cities fortified with packed earth, while 成 contributes the pronunciation chéng.

examples.chinese: 这座城很古老(這座城很古老)。
城墙仍保存完好(城牆仍保存完好)。
examples.english: The city wall is still well preserved.

examples.chinese: 他们在城外修筑防御工事(他們在城外修築防禦工事)。
examples.pinyin: tāmen zài chéngwài xiūzhù fángyù gōngshì.
examples.english: They are building fortifications outside the city.
